communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), I am requesting records related to any potential communications, negotiations, or discussions between AI companies and the operators of Indian Point Nuclear Power Plant, specifically concerning the use of its nuclear energy to power AI, cloud computing, or data center operations.

I am particularly interested in any interactions involving the following companies: Microsoft, Google, OpenAI, Amazon, X, NVIDIA, or other relevant AI companies. 

Specifically, I request the following public records:

Regulatory filings, proposals, or correspondence involving Indian Point's energy allocation or potential deals related to AI or data centers, submitted to or reviewed by the Department of Public Service or the New York State Public Service Commission, or the city government of Peekskill.

Emails, meeting notes, or memoranda between New York State agencies (including the Department of Public Service, NYSERDA, Peekskill city, or other relevant entities) and representatives from Microsoft, Google, OpenAI, Amazon, NVIDIA, or other AI companies about the possibility of using Indian Point's facilities for AI purposes.
Records of any discussions or agreements with AI companies on energy procurement from Indian Point, especially in the context of Indian Point's decommissioning and energy redistribution.
Records of any environmental impact assessments, energy allocation studies, or reviews that involve proposals by AI companies to use nuclear power from Indian Point for data centers or AI projects.
I request records from January 2020 to the present. If there are any fees associated with the provision of these records, please inform me in advance. If possible, I would prefer the records in digital format via email.

Thank you for your attention to this request. Please let me know if this request should be directed to another agency or department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Officer,

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, Documented requests the following records:

All electronic records containing the following keywords and email domains:

“State Freedom Caucus”
“SFCN”
“@statefreedomcaucus.org”
“ Louisiana Freedom Caucus”
“Andrew Roth”
“Andy Roth”
“Greg Price”
“Tim Huelskamp”
Justin Ouimette
Justin.Ouimette@gmail.com
CONNIE HAIR
“Conservative Partnership Institute”
@cpi.org
abroth@statefreedomcaucus.org
roth@statefreedomcaucus.org

All records, both electronic and physical, pertaining to the State Freedom Caucus Foundation summit held on or around September 6-8, 2024 at the Omni Las Colinas in Dallas, Texas. This includes all meeting agendas, handouts, invitations, and other material obtained at or in connection with the summit. This also includes all receipts, confirmations and correspondence related to any and all lodging arrangements, transportation, meals, incidental expenses, and any other event-related expenses.

For both (1) and (2), the search for electronic records should include sent and received emails and any other electronic records including, but not limited to, scheduling and calendar records, text messages, and messages on messaging platforms such as Slack and Microsoft Teams. The search for email records should also include any email accounts used to conduct official business, including personal email addresses such as a "gmail" or "yahoo" account. 

Please include any attachments to those records and other materials enclosed with those records at the time they were transmitted. For instance, for an email that is responsive to our request, please include all prior messages sent or received in that email chain, as well as any attachments to the email.

The scope of this request includes the following state representatives: 

RAYMOND CREWS
BERYL AMEDÉE
JULIE EMERSON
DODIE HORTON 
KATHY EDMONSTON 
DANNY MCCORMICK 
CHUCK OWEN 
BRETT GEYMANN 
PHILLIP TARVER 
RODNEY SCHAMERHORN 
Kellee Hennessey Dickerson

The search for records may be limited to records created, sent, or received between June 1, 2024, through to the date of your final response. We request a fee waiver for this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Victoria Cadostin

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Louisiana State Senate FOIA 10.15.24
